anime.description: * Based on http://anidb.net/cr34736 [Piyo]`s sports comedy manga Teekyuu, serialised in Comic Earth Star. Four girls make up Kameido High School`s Tennis Club, but they do not actually get in much tennis practice; first-year http://anidb.net/ch47680 [Oshimoto Yuri] and second-years http://anidb.net/ch47681 [Shinjou Kanae], http://anidb.net/ch47682 [Takamiya Nasuno], and http://anidb.net/ch47679 [Bandou Marimo] have all long been more likely to get into all sorts of situations, and their daily-life adventures continue. For example, an alien named Tomarin brings Marimo lunch and is shown around the school; on a visit to the public aquarium Marimo is all set to go fishing with her trident; http://anidb.net/ch57487 [Kondou] of the school paper tests the truth of an urban legend on Yuri; Kanae drags Yuri along for some meteor-shower viewing; the girls spend a tumultuous day at the beach; only to end up adrift somewhere on the ocean; Kondou`s older sister shows up and together with Yuri they manage to take a paranormal photo; Kanae and her mother visit grandmother who lives in the African desert... — written by foo2 Note: The Japanese broadcast separates Teekyuu into 12 episode long seasons, even when they air as a single block. Therefore, this entry covers the fourth through seventh Japanese seasons.

tag.name: breast fondling
tag.description: Breast fondling is the act of touching, groping, or fondling the breasts of a person, typically female.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: calling your attacks
tag.description: "GIGAAAAAA DRIIIIIILLL BREAKEEEEEERRR" If you can do something more impressive than just throw a punch, your attack(s) must have an equally impressive name. More than that, you have to call it out as you launch the attack. It doesn`t matter if it`s a martial arts move, a magical spell or your secret superweapon, if you can`t say its name, it just isn`t nearly as cool or effective. Having a special attack is always a must, but not impressive enough. Every special attack needs a name. A really awesome and outstanding name which is easy to remember and even easier and impressive to yell. Because it just is not enough to name your attack. No, to unleash the full power of your attack, you have to call its name in your most MANLY and LOUDEST voice. It does not matter whether it is a martial arts move, a magical spell or flying drills from your mecha, if you can`t call its name, it just isn`t nearly as cool or effective. Not a requirement but wearing shades while calling your attack makes it at least twice as cool, moreover giving your mecha or magical companion shades too results in an immeasurable level of awesomeness, bringing down every enemy just through the POWER OF YOUR VOICE. A standard feature of practically every mecha, mahou shoujo, high fantasy, or martial arts anime. [Source: TV Tropes]

tag.name: space
tag.description: The final frontier.

tag.name: desert
tag.description: Setting with vast amounts of sand, merciless high temperatures, and very little water.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: island
tag.description: Part of this anime takes place on an island, a small landmass that is surrounded by the sea. Generally, an island setting involves interaction with "island" elements. Such elements could include (but is not limited towards): riding on a boat, fishing, foraging/hunting, beach scene, "peaceful island life", being "shipwrecked", island fever, lamenting isolation from the mainland, etc. An island or isle is any piece of sub-continental land that is surrounded by water. Very small islands such as emergent land features on atolls can be called islets, cays or keys. An island in a river or lake may be called an eyot (also ait), or holm. A grouping of geographically or geologically related islands is called an archipelago. (Source: Wikipedia)

tag.name: absurdist humour
tag.description: Surreal humour, also known as absurdist humour, is a form of humour predicated on deliberate violations of causal reasoning, producing events and behaviours that are obviously illogical. Constructions of surreal humour tend to involve bizarre juxtapositions, non-sequiturs, irrational or absurd situations, and expressions of nonsense. The humour arises from a subversion of audience`s expectations, so that amusement is founded on unpredictability, separate from a logical analysis of the situation. Its appeal stems from the fact that the situation described is exceedingly ridiculous or unlikely. On an analytical level, all jokes contain a certain amount of incongruity, but while regular jokes carry an incongruity that the audience accepts as compatible with expectations, absurd jokes are characterized by a disproportionate amount of it, with the punch line delivering a situation incompatible with the world as we know it and failing to resolve the matter in the audience`s eyes. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: medium awareness
tag.description: Medium awareness is the situational and generally temporary awareness characters in works of fiction have and display of the very fact that they are characters in works of fiction. For example, they may comment about the background music, quip about the script or narration, complain about the roles given to them by the writer or their lack of screen time, see the subtitles that appear on screen, inform the audience about the arrival of the commercial break, and even use medium effects as tools. The most common form of medium awareness is known as breaking the fourth wall, in which characters speak directly to the audience, either to it as a whole or to specific members of it. The "fourth wall" is the imaginary "wall" at the front of the stage of a proscenium theatre through which the audience sees the play; it is a metaphor for the boundary between what happens inside the work, to the characters, and outside it, to the audience.

tag.name: other planet
tag.description: The anime will fit this category if some or all of the action takes place on another planet which is supposedly in the same universe as Earth, not a complete fantasy world; usually there has to be some concept of space travel. The Latin name for Earth - Terra, would also pass the condition of being in the same universe as Earth. Basically, even mentioning of Earth existing or having existed would be enough. Although Moon is a moon, it also qualifies as Other Planet.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: tennis
tag.description: Tennis is yet another sport involving hitting a ball. Were it not for the copious amounts of grass involved in certain varieties, it seems hard to imagine that people would pay it any attention at all.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: 4-koma manga
tag.description: Yonkoma manga (4コマ漫画, four cell manga, or 4-koma for short), a comic-strip format, generally consists of gag comic strips within four panels of equal size ordered from top to bottom. (They also sometimes run right-to-left horizontally or use a hybrid 2x2 style, depending on the layout requirements of the publication in which they appear.) Though the word yonkoma comes from the Japanese, the style also exists outside of Japan in other Asian countries as well as in the English-speaking market.

tag.name: pantsu
tag.description: "Panties" in Japanese. Upskirt views in various positions are typical, however all forms of partial or fully exposed panties are accepted. Exposure is usually accidental, but may also be deliberate. Pantsu views may be exclusive to the viewer without impacting any characters. Bikinis are not pantsu.

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: ecchi
tag.description: Fan service is found in many anime, in many forms. When the service has a distinctly sexual slant to it, and it appears to be a major focus of the show, then it`s safe to assume you`re watching ecchi. The word "ecchi" is used by English-speaking anime fans to refer to refer to soft-core pornographic or sexually suggestive anime and manga. This is a western invention; in Japanese, it is a catch-all term for all things anyhow sexual in nature, not being limited to porn, but also not really considered a "milder" term, as it may also refer to sexual intercourse itself. The term "ecchi" in Japanese comes from the pronunciation of the letter "H" in English, which is rendered into Japanese syllabary as エッチ, which in turn is transliterated in the English alphabet as "ecchi" or "etchi". It is not, as many believe, short for "hentai" -- that, too, seems to be a western invention. It is, however, nearly as misunderstood and misapplied a term as "hentai". The line between ecchi and hentai, from the western perspective over these terms, can be hard to draw at times; one good rule of thumb is: if it was aired on Japanese public TV at all, it probably wasn`t hentai. Ecchi usually features all the specifics to human anatomy that can only be found in anime, and generally avoids full nudity, instead abusing of panty shots. Hentai, on the other hand, will usually show full frontal nudity in some explicit form, including genitalia, and full, intimate sex scenes. At its mildest, ecchi is composed of double entendres, big misunderstandings, and sexual farce; at its most explicit, it is still in the realm of softcore pornography, with full breast shots, full back nudity and similar content, but no display of genitalia. Another good way to distinguish the two is looking for animated sex scenes; if one is found, you have generally left the genre entirely, though a few borderline exceptions apply here. For AniDB`s purposes, the distinction between explicit ecchi and actual hentai is simple: if it was sold with a 18+ restriction in its country of origin, it is hentai; if it was sold without it, it is ecchi. Source: TV Tropes

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: unidentified flying object
tag.description: An unidentified flying object, or UFO, is in its strictest definition any apparent object in the sky that is not identifiable as a known object or phenomenon. However, the term is widely used in popular culture to refer more specifically to supposed observations of craft of extraterrestrial origin. Most UFOs are later identified as conventional objects or phenomena (e.g., aircraft, weather balloons, clouds). Some of them are not identified, either because of lack of evidence or because no conventional explanation can be found despite extensive evidence. Some people consider the latter cases as possible observations of extraterrestrial space craft. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: ocean
tag.description: The large bodies of salt water surrounding the continents and islands are a (significant) setting of this anime.

tag.name: some weird shit goin` on
tag.description: Scenes of this show point to insanely strange events which seem to be taking place; throughout its episodes, the show may or may not explain what is going on. Either way, many viewers will find that a succinct and accurate way to describe the show is "WTF?", and the show`s explanations (or lack thereof) to the events will often be subject of heated debate.

tag.name: watercolour style
tag.description: A watercolour or aquarelle is a painting method in which the paints are made of pigments suspended in a water-based solution. Some anime are created in the style of watercolour paintings, the watercolour style, usually with faded pastels that often give the show a warm and friendly visual presentation. In modern anime, this is generally achieved via computer effects that create an imitation of watercolour, rather than by creating real-life watercolour art. While the watercolour style is more commonly used for backgrounds, it is possible to create the entire anime in such a style.

tag.name: fast-paced
tag.description: Hold onto your hats, this anime`s storyline is relentless. The characters don`t get time to take a breath as events keep both them and the viewer on a roller coaster ride of revelation and excitement! Hopefully it all makes sense...

tag.name: randomness
tag.description: The anime does not follow a predictable storyline. New, strange, obscure, or otherwise unexpected story elements are introduced at a whim.

tag.name: short episodes
tag.description: Short episodes are regular episodes that are much shorter than the standard length. This means up to and including 10 minutes; shows with episodes that are 11 to 20 minutes in length are http://anidb.net/t6494 [half-length episodes] instead. Not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t6349 [multi-segment episodes], which are regular episodes that are split into several short segments (parts), usually with separate titles and independent storylines.

tag.name: diet
tag.description: One or more of the characters in this anime go on a diet, to lose some weight. Typically a female character will be extremely distressed that her clothes no longer fit, or that her ideal weight has been exceeded. Ironically, normal growth is often the explanation. Since diets do not work, this ends up as a comedy element, with many ridiculous attempts to get slim quickly.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: bowling
tag.description: Bowling refers to a series of sports or leisure activities in which a player rolls or throws a bowling ball towards a target. Source: Wikipedia

episode.title: 先輩とランボー
Rambo with Senpai
Senpai to Rambo
episode.summary: Kanae and Yuri discuss watching the meteor show said to appear that night. They plan to gether on the roof of Nasuno`s house, but... Will they be able to see the meteor shower? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とトレインスポッティング
Trainspotting with Senpai
Senpai to Train Spotting
episode.summary: Kondo-san of the school paper asks Yuri for help with investigating the legend of the cherry tree growing in the school yard. Apparently something strange happens to those who receive romantic confessions underneath the tree. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とロミオ・マスト・ダイ
Romeo Must Die with Senpai
Senpai to Romeo Must Die
episode.summary: For some reason Kanae receives aquarium tickets from a man riding an elephant. The girls decide to go together, but the situation at the aquarium becomes increasingly inappropriate... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とメン・イン・ブラック
Men in Black with Senpai
Senpai to Men in Black
episode.summary: When Marimo forgets her lunch at home, her freeloading alien roommate Tomarin comes to deliver it. The girls decide to show Tomarin around Kameido High School, but for some reason school`s a little unusual that day... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とハムナプトラ
The Mummy with Senpai
Senpai to Hamunaptra
episode.summary: Kanae travels to her grandmother`s home in the middle of the Egyptian desert to visit her grandfather`s grave. It seems her extraordinary behavior comes from her grandmother. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とスターリングラード
Enemy at the Gates with Senpai
Senpai to Stalingrad
episode.summary: Yuri is shown paranormal photos at Udonko`s shop. She tries to welcome home Udonko`s older sister and is shocked to learn she`s the ghost she once met at a funeral. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とキャスト・アウェイ
Cast Away with Senpai
Senpai to Cast Away
episode.summary: Yuri panics as the previous episode requires a sequel. Though the girls end up adrift at sea, Yuri wonders if the relaxed upperclassmen truly are just brave. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とジョーズ
Jaws with Senpai
Senpai to Jaws
episode.summary: The swimsuit episode is finally here! Everyone is brimming with excitement as they enjoy the beach in a variety of ways, but... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とアポカリプト
Apocalypto with Senpai
Senpai to Apocalypto
episode.summary: Nasuno and Marimo have tea at a cafe. When Nasuno says she wants to work a part-time job to learn more about society, Marimo begins passionately offering advice based on her one day of work at a pork bowl restaurant! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とバグズ・ライフ
A Bug`s Life with Senpai
Senpai to Bug`s Life
episode.summary: The girls are hanging out at a candy store in the middle of summer vacation. When Kanae suggests they do something special for summer vacation, they begin throwing around ideas. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とショーン・オブ・ザ・デッド
Shaun of the Dead with Senpai
Senpai to Shaun of the Dead
episode.summary: Marimo and Tomarin walk through town in the blazing heat. Inside an air-conditioned electronics store, Marimo begins explaining human electronics to Tomarin, but... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とGOAL!
Goal! with Senpai
Senpai to Goal!
episode.summary: Yota practices to prepare for a practice soccer match. Nasuno offers to be his training partner, but she makes a ridiculous suggestion to help him win the game. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩と猫の恩返し
The Cat Returns with Senpai
Senpai to Neko no Ongaeshi
episode.summary: After losing an obstacle course race in a sports festival long past, the tennis club is assigned to pick up garbage in the school`s courtyard. Marimo comments on how ironic it is that society`s garbage should have to pick up garbage, when... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とビューティフル・ドリーマー
Beautiful Dreamer with Senpai
Senpai to Beautiful Dreamer
episode.summary: Today is the cultural festival! Yuri`s class is putting on a tuna dissection show. Yuri and Udonko begin crawling full speed ahead to check out the other class` attractions. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とキリング・フィールド
The Killing Fields with Senpai
Senpai to Killing Field
episode.summary: The girls arrive in Cambodia. They go on a conventional sightseeing tour, visiting ruins and more ruins in a tuk tuk. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とターミナル
The Terminal with Senpai
Senpai to Terminal
episode.summary: The girls win tickets to a certain place is a shopping mall lottery. Their destination is overseas, and they begin preparing for their trip, but... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とミッション: インポッシブル
Mission: Impossible with Senpai
Senpai to Mission: Impossible
episode.summary: Kanae suddenly enters the classroom while spitting blood. The lead-in is the same until this point, but don`t let that bother you. The girls decide to scout out a rival school, but...? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とレザボア・ドッグス
Reservoir Dogs with Senpai
Senpai to Reservoir Dogs
episode.summary: Kanae suddenly enters the classroom while spitting blood. Shocked and dismayed, Marimo cannot contain her anger when she sees her hurt friend. In her quest to avenger her friend, she becomes a goddess of revenge... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とエイリアンVSプレデター
Alien vs. Predator with Senpai
Senpai to Alien vs Predator
episode.summary: Udonko decides to do a story on the mysterious alien Tomarin. The jokes fly during the interview due to their surprisingly good chemistry. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とダイ・ハード3
Die Hard 3 with Senpai
Senpai to Die Hard 3
episode.summary: The girls decide to hold a takoyaki party to celebrate fall. When they realize they have none of the necessary ingredients, they go to the store to buy some. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とジョンQ
John Q with Senpai
Senpai to John Q
episode.summary: My grandma`s in the hospital for Tommy John surgery. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とソーシャル・ネットワーク
The Social Network with Senpai
Senpai to Social Network
episode.summary: This mallet and mortar have been passed down for generations. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とデイ・アフター・トゥモロー
The Day After Tomorrow with Senpai
Senpai to Day After Tomorrow
episode.summary: Seasons turn, and winter arrives. As Yuri walks through town in the brisk air, with a sidelong glance to Marimo slipping across frozen puddles, she spots Kanae wearing a mask for once. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩と賢者の石
Senpai and the Philosopher`s Stone
Senpai to Kenja no Ishi
episode.summary: The girls decide to roast potatoes. A certain fellow probably knows the most about sweets, but that aside, things don`t generally go well for the girls as they can`t find kindling and fail to start a fire properly... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とミスティック・リバー
Mystic River with Senpai
Senpai to Mystic River
先輩とバック・トゥ・ザ・フューチャー
Back to the Future with Senpai
Senpai to Back to the Future
先輩とプレミアム・ラッシュ
Premium Rush with Senpai
Senpai to Premium Rush
episode.summary: The cherry blossoms are blooming, and the girls decide to go flower watching. When they arrive at the park, Yuri notices they`ve brought a few friends with them. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩と武士の一分
Love and Honor with Senpai
Senpai to Bushi no Ichibu
episode.summary: With Valentine`s Day just around the corner, Udonko and Yuri decide to make chocolate. However, it seems Udonko is very confused about what Valentine`s Day and even chocolate are supposed to be. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とゴールデンアイ
GoldenEye with Senpai
Senpai to Golden Eye
episode.summary: Kanae needs a new phone, but the clerk at the store keeps offering her products that are definitely not phones. Will Kanae and Yuri leave the store with a phone that can actually make calls? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とバックドラフト
Backdraft with Senpai
Senpai to Backdraft
episode.summary: The upperclassmen of the Tennis Club have PE class outside on a cold day. After warming up with exercise moves of their own creation, they take on the high jump. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩と魔法にかけられて
Enchanted with Senpai
Senpai to Mahou ni Kakerarete
episode.summary: Once upon a time, there was a girl named Cinderella who wanted nothing more than to attend the party at the castle. However, with 245 evil sisters intead of two, will she be able to attend the party and meet her prince? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とダークナイト
The Dark Knight with Senpai
Senpai to Dark Knight
episode.summary: When Mika tears her ACL, Bobby asks the girls to take her place in his annual hero show. Yuri is unsure, but the other members enthusiastically agree to do it. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とボウリング・フォー・コロンバイン
Bowling for Columbine with Senpai
Senpai to Bowling for Columbine
episode.summary: Udonko begs Yuri and Kanae for help with her family`s udon business. They agree to help make udon at the shop and are taught the ins and outs of udon by a very special teacher. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とトレマーズ
Tremors with Senpai
Senpai to Tremors
episode.summary: The earth moves... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とウィンブルドン
Wimbledon with Senpai
Senpai to Wimbledon
episode.summary: The team`s annual "Practice Super Seriously Day" has arrived. While the girls do indeed practice something that resembles tennis, it`s still a far cry from "serious practice." Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とミート・ザ・ペアレンツ
Meet the Parents with Senpai
Senpai to Meet the Parents
episode.summary: The girls decide to form a band to get more out of their youth. However, the discussion quickly reaches an unusually serious level with tons of realistic terminology thrown around. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩と2001年宇宙の旅
2001: A Space Odyssey with Senpai
Senpai to 2001-nen Uchuu no Tabi
episode.summary: Marimo and her friends are trapped on an alien planet when their spaceship breaks down. While searching for the rubber band they need to repair their ship`s engine, they come across a strange domed structure. When they open the door, they find a shocking surprise waiting for them. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩と猿の惑星
Planet of the Apes with Senpai
Senpai to Saru no Waksei
episode.summary: Marimo runs into Udonko, who is on her way to look for an unidentified flying object that crashed into a nearby park. While searching for the UFO, they meet up with Tomarin and Tanaka-san, who points them in the direction of some peculiar "playground equipment." Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩と呪怨
Ju-On with Senpai
Senpai to Ju-On
episode.summary: Right off the bat, Kanae-senpai is slurping cup noodles at the bottom of a giant hole. In the heavily accented speech of a pioneer, she invites Yuri to climb down into the hole and help her dig...? The long-awaited seventh season has begun! We look forward to another great year of Tekyu! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とテッド
Ted with Senpai
Senpai to Ted
episode.summary: Kanae and Marimo are hanging out at the park on a cold day. When a bear happens to wander by, they decide to question him about his hibernation habits, but the bear has some shocking answers for them. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とデンジャラス・ビューティー
Miss Congeniality with Senpai
Senpai to Dangerous Beauty
episode.summary: When Yuri and Marimo realize they`re gaining weight, they decide to go on a diet. The naturally slim Kanae offers to coach them, but her advice is shaky at best. Will the girls be able to lose weight? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とブロークバック・マウンテン
Brokeback Mountain with Senpai
Senpai to Brokeback Mountain
episode.summary: "Summer vacation is almost over," Kanae remarks during the introduction. Yuri snaps back precisely, "This anime`s seasons are totally random." And that anime, Tekyu, is about to start again! Yahoooo!!!! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とアイアンクラッド
Ironclad with Senpai
Senpai to Ironclad
episode.summary: Kanae`s grandmother moves back to Japan from Egypt for no reason. Yuri is invited to help pick fruit. Grandma, fruit, help pick. Okay?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とエクソシスト
The Exorcist with Senpai
Senpai to Exorcist
episode.summary: When Yuri runs into Annenkov, she gets dragged into a mixer with Annenkov and her friends. However, no one would have expected the kind of men who show up and the disaster that befalls her in the bathroom. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とベティ・サイズモア
Nurse Betty with Senpai
Senpai to Betty Sizemore
episode.summary: When Yuri doesn`t come to school one day, the third years ask Udonko where she is. When they learn she`s home sick with a cold, they arrange a trip to visit her. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とグランド・ブダペスト・ホテル
The Grand Budapest Hotel with Senpai
Senpai to Grand Budapest Hotel
episode.summary: When Kanae complains about the cafeteria`s food, the new lunch lady challenges her to a school food showdown. Kanae accepts, but on the day of the event, she is sitting at the commentator`s table, while participating in her place is an all too familiar face. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とフューリー
Fury with Senpai
Senpai to Fury
episode.summary: One day at school, Yuri suddenly hears Udonko`s voice in her mind. Using her newfound telepathic powers, Udonko suggests they go bowling. With the rest of the Tennis Club in tow, Udonko leads them to the bowling alley which turns out to be located somewhere familiar to the group. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とプライベート・ライアン
Saving Private Ryan with Senpai
Senpai to Private Ryan
episode.summary: Kanae comes up with a brilliant new way for the girls to practice. Will their new practice methods enable them to finally compete in and win the national tournament? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とストレイト・ストーリー
The Straight Story with Senpai
Senpai to Straight Story
episode.summary: The tennis club is going camping! With baseball equipment, gold-plated RV, and not a single member with a driver`s license, the girls are ready to go. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩と桐島, 部活やめるってよ
The Kirishima Thing with Senpai
Senpai to Kirishima, Bukatsu Yamerutte yo
episode.summary: Yuri is shocked when the seniors of the tennis club suggest they practice with the tennis club of Usakame High, their rival school`s team. Though their announcement initially brings tears of joys to her eyes, they`re quickly replaced by her regular irritation when she realizes just how similar the two teams are. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先輩とジングル・オール・ザ・ウェイ
Jingle All the Way with Senpai
Senpai to Jingle All the Way
先輩とパシフィック・リム
Pacific Rim with Senpai
Senpai to Pacific Rim
先輩とチャイルド・プレイ
OVA 11
Senpai to Child Play
先輩とノース・ウォーリアーズ
OVA 12
Senpai to North Warriors
